main event: On 5 April 1949, observers at Cleveland Municipal Airport reported seeing a red light in the sky that appeared to be stationary, with no sound or trail, for approximately 15 minutes.
interesting points: The object was observed by multiple witnesses including control tower operators and weather bureau staff.,It was described as a deep red light resembling a navigation light, visible from 10 to 15 miles away.,The light was observed at an altitude of approximately 10,000 to 15,000 feet and at a 30-40 degree elevation.,The object faded out suddenly without any sound or trail, making it unclear what it was.,Similar sightings were reported on subsequent nights, leading to continued investigation by the Air Force.
sighted object: a red light in the sky
witness description: airport control tower operators and various local residents
